intro: Scorzonera valentina, commonly known as the Valentina scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and rough, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Scorzonera valentina is also known for its edible roots, which have a slightly sweet and nutty flavor. It is often cultivated in gardens for both its ornamental value and culinary uses.
